definition: fat/fertile/loose-fitting or large/to fertilize/to become rich by illegal means/fertilizer/manure
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: Rockier than a soap opera marriage.
sentences.chinese: 比肥皂劇的婚禮還要糟糕。

sentences.english: Could Kim Jong Il's regime really be brought undone by K-pop and South Korean soap operas?
sentences.chinese: 金正日政權真的有可能被韓國音樂和肥皂劇推翻嗎？

sentences.english: As a result, networks will be rerunning some late-night talk shows and soap operas.
sentences.chinese: 結果是，網絡將播放一些午夜脫口秀和肥皂劇。

sentences.english: Its prime-time schedule is packed with reality TV and soap operas.
sentences.chinese: 他的黃金時間節目表中充滿了紀實節目和肥皂劇。

sentences.english: which is a kind of soap about hospital life.
sentences.chinese: 它是一部講述醫院生活的肥皂劇。

sentences.english: So I don't demean that any more than I demean soap operas.
sentences.chinese: 所以我不貶低它，我更瞧不起肥皂劇。

sentences.english: But I've been able to see my favorite soap, ''Shortland Street.''
sentences.chinese: 但我能看到我喜愛的肥皂劇《肖特蘭街》。

sentences.english: They larded many commercials into a ten-minute period before the soap opera.
sentences.chinese: 他們在肥皂劇前的十分鐘內插播了許多商業廣告。

sentences.english: A small colour television was tuned to an afternoon soap opera.
sentences.chinese: 一臺小彩色電視機頻道調在了一出下午的肥皂劇上。

sentences.english: Soap opera is for TV what the popular novel is for books.
sentences.chinese: 肥皂劇之於電視，猶如通俗小說之於書籍。

sentences.english: It's just one of a new genre of telenovelas about Mexico's explosive drug war.
sentences.chinese: 該劇關於墨西哥毒品戰，屬於新的電視肥皂劇種類。

sentences.english: Soaps need to remain contemporary: life and society are both constantly evolving.
sentences.chinese: 生活和社會都在不斷變遷，肥皂劇也需要跟上時代。

sentences.english: We''ll have a soap opera series on TV this week.
sentences.chinese: 這週末我們會在電視上看到一系列肥皂劇。

sentences.english: We'll get a soap opera series on TV that week.
sentences.chinese: 這週末咱們會在電視上看到一集錦肥皂劇。

sentences.english: Why are you wasting your time watching a stupid soap opera?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼你把時間花消在看愚昧的肥皂劇上？

sentences.english: In two ears do not hear out of the window, concentric intentions only watching soap operas.
sentences.chinese: 兩耳不聞窗外事，同心用心只看肥皂劇。

definition: Wolf Totem, novel by Lü Jiamin aka Jiang Rong
lit. the lioness from Hedong roars (idiom)/fig. refers to a shrewish wife or a henpecked husband
see 領盒飯|领盒饭[ling3 he2 fan4]
La Comédie humaine, series of novels by 19th century French novelist Honoré de Balzac 巴爾扎克|巴尔扎克[Ba1 er3 zha1 ke4]
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to make a fool of oneself
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
